intro: Potentilla paucidentata, commonly known as the few-toothed cinquefoil, is a low-growing perennial shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It typically reaches a height of about 10–30 centimeters and features wiry, branched stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are compound, consisting of five elliptical leaflets with few or no teeth, giving it its scientific name. Potentilla paucidentata thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or rocky habitats.
